Please stand in the queue. Limit your baggage to 15 kgs and size of baggage should not exceed: 60 cm length x 45cm breadth x 25 cm height. Please use the dustbins. Please stand on the left side of the escalator. Please move away from the escalators immediately after use. Please remember that the train stops for 30 seconds only. Show your tickets to metro personnel, when asked to. Consider the comfort of your fellow passengers. Abstain from drunken and unruly behavior. Take care of your belongings. Please contact station controller or customer care for assistance. Please offer your seat to children, pregnant women and elderly passengers. Please give preference to differently abled, pregnant women and senior citizens when taking the lift. PARK AT YOUR OWN RISK. Don’t travel without your smartcard or token. Don’t share your card or token with another person on the same journey. Don’t jump over the ticket barrier. Don’t cross the yellow line on the platform. Don’t step onto the metro tracks. Don’t try to force the train doors open. Don’t stick posters or indulge in graffiti inside the train or metro station. Don’t step on the tactile meant for the visually challenged. Don’t take the lift it is meant for the physically challenged and aged. Don’t carry firearms or knives. Don’t bring pets inside the metro station premises or trains. Don’t smoke. Don’t eat or drink in the trains or metro station premises. All stations are designed with disabled-friendly facilities like escalators, lifts, Toilets,ramped and tactile\n\nTactile tiles are provided at all stations to enable the visually impaired to travel from the entrance to the platform without assistance.\n\nAdaptation of toilets for wheelchair users, Braille symbols and auditory signals in elevators, and warning signals appropriate places are other disabled-friendly features available stations.\n\nFor hearing impaired commuters, directional and information signage is provided at the stations. Dynamic display giving travel information is provided in stations.\n\nAudio announcements giving travel and general information for visually challenged people.\n\nAudio frequency induction Loop System giving travel and general information for hearing impaired people.\n\nPassenger emergency telephone in platform and lift intercom phone to contact CMRL staffs in case of emergency.\n\nWide automatic gates are provided for wheelchair users.\n\nDisable friendly Ticket Vending Machine with Help button for operator assistance, Audio announcements along with Audio frequency induction loop system and braille symbols. 186-04251515 chennaimetrorail@cmrl.in Admin Building CMRL Depot,\nPoonamallee High Road,\nKoyambedu,\nChennai-600107,\nTamil Nadu, India A separate Lost and Found office is setup at Alandur metro station at the below for proper storage of lost and found articles disposal and keeping records. Alandur Station Contact Number 044-23792220 Customer care Number 1860-425-155 Alandur metro station Trichy - Chennai Highway,\nAlandur, Chennai,\nTamil Nadu - 600016 Instruction to Commuters The passengers who lost their articles anywhere in chennai metro rail premises or trains, should approach customer care of the given station within 24 hours. After 24 hours passengers may collect their lost articles at alandur metro station lost and found office between 10 P.M to 5 P.M all days except sundays The Lost articles will be handed over to the Claimant/Passengers only after proper verification of his/her valid ID proof Passenger/Claimant may also check their lost articles on CMRL Website : www.chennaimetrorail.org If the lost articles are not claimed within one month, the deposited lost articles at Lost and found office will be disposed off. Alandur Count,Thiliganaga nagar,Anjaneyar koil.\nVanuvampattai,Medavakkam Main Road,Balammal Main Road, Balaji Nagar Main Road,Ring Road,\nVelachery R.S.,Velachery B.S. - Marina Beach Edward Elliots Beach Fort St. George Vivekanandar Illam Spencer Plaza Arignar Anna Zoological Park Parthasarathy Temple Ripon Building Marina Beach is a natural urban beach in the city of Chennai,India along the Bay of Bengal. Elliots Beach is located in Besant Nagar, Chennai, India. It forms the end-point of the Marina Beach shore. Fort St George is the name of the first English fortress in India, founded in 1644 at the coastal city of Madras. Vivekanandar Illam is a Structure at Chennai,India,used by the British to Store the ice brought from Great Lakes in North America for about 30 years. Spencer Plaza was built in 1864,established by Charles Durant and J.W Spencer in Anna Salai,then Known as Mount Road,in the Madras Presidency. Arignar Anna Zoological Park, also known as the Vandalur Zoo, is a zoological garden located in Vandalur, a suburb in the southwestern part of Chennai, Tamil Nadu. The Parthasarathy Temple is an 8th century Hindu Vaishnavite temple dedicated to the god Krishna,located at Triplicane,Chennai,India. The Ripon Building is the seat of the Chennai Corporation in Chennai, Tamil Nadu. It is a fine example of the Neoclassical style of architecture, a combination of, Ionic and Corinthian. Vivekananda Cultural Centre Inko Centre Russian Center of Science and Culture Nandalala Cultural Centre Alliance Française of Madras Vivekanada House an important landmark in Chennai is associated with the Sri Ramakrishna Math since 1897 when Swami Vivekananda stayed here for nine days after his triumphant return from the West. Inko Centre aims to promote an inter-cultural dialogue by facilitating a consistent programme that draws on the rich traditions of both India and Korea. The Consulate General of the Russian Federation in Chennai represents the interests of the Russian government in the southern region of India. The Nandalala Seva Samithi Trust was founded by Pujyasri Mathioli Saraswathy in the Year 1988. Alliance Française of Madras is a Franco-Indian non-profit association in Chennai, India,with mission to teach the French language to the people in the region.
